name: Problem Formulation
description: Enter a description of the problem formulation, including a clear assessment question

name: Relevant existing data
description: Search for available data about this compound in existing data sources (see suggested links)

name: Is the information sufficient
description: Justify if existing data is sufficient for answering the question posed in the Problem Formulation

name: Is exposure scenario well defined
description: Justify if the exposure scenario is well defined in existing data

name: Definition of maximum exposure Emax
description: Define the maximum exposure (Emax) value. Document this choice

name: Is the TTC applicable
description: Justify if a decision based on the Threshold of Toxicological Concern can be applicable

name: Consider wheter TTC may be applicable
description: TTC applicability

name: Identify use scenario
description: Identify which are the relevant use scenarios, in the context of the problem formulation. Document the data sources

name: Estimate external exposure
description: Estimate the external exposure

name: Prioritise parameters using expert judgements
description: Prioritize the toxico kinetic parameters which should be estimated first, considering the use scenario and the characteristics of the compound

name: Generate in vitro data for highly sensitive/uncertain parameters
description: Apply suitable in vitro methods for estimating the toxico kinetics parameters that can were considered to have the highest priority.

name: Generate in silico parameters
description: Calculate PK parameters using in silico methods

name: Run PBPK model
description: Calculate PK parameters using PBPK

name: Perform uncertainty and variability analysis
description: Estimate the uncertainty and variability of critical parameters

name: Perform sensitivity analysis
description: Perform sensitivity analysis

name: Generate estimates of highest test concentration
description: Estimate the highest test concentration

name: Is the information sufficient?
description: Justify if the information generated so far is sufficient to answer the question posed in the Problem Formulation

name: Generate in silico predictions of hazard
description: Apply a battery of in silico methods for relevant hazard

name: Generate HT in vitro data
description: Apply Hight-throughput transcriptomics to identify the main genes and pathways which are activated by the tested compounds

name: Integration of results
description: Integrate the results obtained so far by different methods, identifying the most important conclusions, related with the Problem Formulation

name: Is a toxicological alert identified?
description: Evaluate if the results of the structural alerts justify to exit from the assessment
